headline: Israeli cyber startup Noma Security raises $100 million in private funding round
summary: Israeli cybersecurity startup Noma Security, whose platform secures enterprise data and AI models against AI agents, said on Thursday it raised $100 million in a private funding round, bringing total funds raised to date to $132 million. Israel's cyber security sector has been active of late and many startups have raised significant sums in funding rounds and in mergers and acquisitions. A surge in cyberattacks, including data breaches and ransomware, has driven demand for more comprehensive defences and fueled interest in cyber firms.

headline: KeyBanc downgrades Palo Alto Networks on CyberArk acquisition concerns
summary: Investing.com -- KeyBanc Capital Markets downgraded Palo Alto Networks (NASDAQ:PANW) to Sector Weight from Overweight saying there are strategic concerns tied to the company’s planned acquisition of identity security firm CyberArk.The brokerage said it sees limited synergy between Palo Alto’s core focus on network and security operations and CyberArk’s specialization in identity access management. “We think customers will prefer to use an independent vendor solely focused on identity,” analysts

headline: Palo Alto Networks to acquire CyberArk in $25bn deal
